abstract: Sec of State John Kerry says nuclear deal he negotiated with Iran is in Israel's interest and expresses concern that Israel could become further isolated if it opposes deal, particularly if opposition results in deal being rejected by United States Congress; comments are met with criticism from some Israelis and experts.
lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry said the deal with Iran was in Israel’s interest, but several foreign policy experts said his remarks risked worsening relations between the countries.

headline.main: Kerry Says Israel May Deepen Its Isolation by Opposing Iran Nuclear Accord
headline.print_headline: Kerry Says Israel May Deepen Its Isolation by Opposing Iran Nuclear Accord

snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry said the deal with Iran was in Israel’s interest, but several foreign policy experts said his remarks risked worsening relations between the countries.
